definition: colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: It used to be said that English people take their pleasures sadly.
sentences.chinese: 人們常說英國人哪怕遇上樂事也還是落落寡歡。

sentences.english: But among them , his nephew , misfitted , felt that he was going to die .
sentences.chinese: 可是在他們中間，他的外甥卻落落寡歡，甚至想到死。

sentences.english: There are many ways to get a college degree and one of them is by taking classes right online at your own convenience.
sentences.chinese: 但是，班裏的女生陳佳佳卻感到自己總是落落寡歡。
